title: Almost perfect
review: I bought this before a long international trip as inflight entertainment for my almost two year oldPros its super fun to use I even love doing it My son was able to figure it out right away and also really enjoyed it Theres ZERO chance of making a mess or losing pieces so its great for the car or a planeCons slightly noisy though I dont mind Main issue and reason I said ALMOST perfect is that some of the holes are just slightly smaller and the metal balls fall down as soon as you pull them up Not a huge issue given the price but if I had bought this as a mindfulness exercise for myself Id also have to work on my patience and acceptance Overall worth the money especially for travel

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2022
name: Careshmeh
title: LOVES THIS ITEM! Used a drillâ€¦
review: I have a 6 year old and a two year old and they LOVE these However I bought them to take on a trip and knew the pens would get lost immediately so I used a 332 drill bit and put a hole through middle section of the magnet pens and on each board I then opened the back with a screwdriver and tied one end inside closed it and tied the pen to the other end The pens fit snugly so I couldnt just tie something and glue around it I ran a nylon thread through the middle holesVWALLA The pens will not get lost on this mama
response: {"Review Summary": "Great for kids, but modifications needed to prevent loss of pens","Observed Technical Facts": "Magnetic pens, nylon thread modification","Improvements expected / what users request": "Better pen storage solution","Complaints and issues users have experienced": "Pens get lost easily","How the product is used": "Entertaining kids","Where the product is used": "At home, on trips","Sentiment": "Positive","Anger": "No","Anger Reason": "N/A","Delight": "Yes","Delight Reason": "Kids love it","Disappointment": "No","Disappointment Reason": "N/A","Time": "Unknown","Season": "Unknown","Weather": "Unknown","User Known": "No","User Description": "Parent of young children"}

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2023
name: Gia
title: Great fun!
review: Everyone loves thisI bought it for my blind kid who was instantly charmedShe loves the tactile drawing experience and pushing the balls back down as wellIt would be great if it were a little easier to get one ball at a time to raise especially when using ones fingers to check the drawing often a group of 3 or 4 will raise when placing the stylus on the boardThis prevented her from writing her name in braille which would otherwise have been possible and a real bonus for blind kids everywhere to be able to create the picture they are thinking of and sign itWith some practice she can push down just the balls she wants to leaving the picture or letter she was going for but it makes for a bit of tedium The sighted ppl are very happy with it Overall it was a great purchase  and I will buy more for the rest of the kids in my clan

name: Careshmeh
title: LOVES THIS ITEM! Used a drillâ€¦
review: I have a 6 year old and a two year old and they LOVE these However I bought them to take on a trip and knew the pens would get lost immediately so I used a 332 drill bit and put a hole through middle section of the magnet pens and on each board I then opened the back with a screwdriver and tied one end inside closed it and tied the pen to the other end The pens fit snugly so I couldnt just tie something and glue around it I ran a nylon thread through the middle holesVWALLA The pens will not get lost on this mama

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2023
name: Gia
title: Great fun!
review: Everyone loves thisI bought it for my blind kid who was instantly charmedShe loves the tactile drawing experience and pushing the balls back down as wellIt would be great if it were a little easier to get one ball at a time to raise especially when using ones fingers to check the drawing often a group of 3 or 4 will raise when placing the stylus on the boardThis prevented her from writing her name in braille which would otherwise have been possible and a real bonus for blind kids everywhere to be able to create the picture they are thinking of and sign itWith some practice she can push down just the balls she wants to leaving the picture or letter she was going for but it makes for a bit of tedium The sighted ppl are very happy with it Overall it was a great purchase  and I will buy more for the rest of the kids in my clan

title: Long term entertainment

name: loveadict44
title: Fun but LOUD.
review: So my kid likes it But I ultimately bought it to add to my arsenal of busy toys for when she has to sit through her brothers PT appointments since I have to bring her along with us The problem that I did not anticipate is that this toy is VERY loud and isnt conducive to a quiet drs office The magnetic beads inside rattle loudly when shifted but it also makes very noisy clacking sounds when the magnetic bead is drawn up or pushed back down It is actually astounding how loud it can be I expected maybe a small amount of noise but its quite amplified Theres just no way to prevent it I had no idea it was going to be as noisy as it is or I wouldnt have bought it
response: {"Review Summary": "Toy is too loud for quiet environments, but kid enjoys it as a busy toy.","Observed Technical Facts": "Magnetic beads inside, makes loud rattling and clacking sounds","Improvements expected / what users request": "Quieter operation","Complaints and issues users have experienced": "Toy is very loud and not conducive to quiet environments","How the product is used": "As a busy toy for a child during appointments","Where the product is used": "Doctor's office","Sentiment": "Negative","Anger": "No","Anger Reason": "N/A","Delight": "No","Delight Reason": "N/A","Disappointment": "Yes","Disappointment Reason": "Toy is too loud for quiet environments","Time": "Unknown","Season": "Unknown","Weather": "Unknown","User Known": "No","User Description": "Parent who purchased the toy for their child"}

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2022
name: Careshmeh
title: LOVES THIS ITEM! Used a drillâ€¦
review: I have a 6 year old and a two year old and they LOVE these However I bought them to take on a trip and knew the pens would get lost immediately so I used a 332 drill bit and put a hole through middle section of the magnet pens and on each board I then opened the back with a screwdriver and tied one end inside closed it and tied the pen to the other end The pens fit snugly so I couldnt just tie something and glue around it I ran a nylon thread through the middle holesVWALLA The pens will not get lost on this mama
response: {"Review Summary": "Great for kids, but modifications needed to prevent loss of pens","Observed Technical Facts": "Magnet pens, nylon thread modification","Improvements expected / what users request": "Better pen storage solution","Complaints and issues users have experienced": "Pens get lost easily","How the product is used": "Entertaining kids","Where the product is used": "At home, on trips","Sentiment": "Positive","Anger": "No","Anger Reason": "N/A","Delight": "Yes","Delight Reason": "Kids love it","Disappointment": "No","Disappointment Reason": "N/A","Time": "Unknown","Season": "Unknown","Weather": "Unknown","User Known": "No","User Description": "Parent of young children"}
